question: 割る
sourceAnswer: to{} divide | cut/halve/separate/split/rip | break/crack/smash | dilute | fall-below | discount | step-over-(a-line,-etc.)
sourceMnemonic:
Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>divide</kanji> so the verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to divide</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to split something</vocabulary>.

It can also mean <vocabulary>to break something</vocabulary>, as in <ja>ワイングラスを割る</ja> (to break a wine glass). After all, you’re technically dividing the object into parts if you break it, right?
sourceReadingMnemonic: The reading you learned with the kanji is the one you'll use here. It's the <ja>わ</ja> one, though, making it <ja>わる</ja>.
